verses.roman:
nara-lokaṁ parityajya
rājyaṁ nihata-kaṇṭakam
asmān pālayato vīra
kāmās te sarva ujjhitāḥ

synonyms: nara-lokam—in the world of men; parityajya—abandoning; rājyam—a kingdom; nihata—removed; kaṇṭakam—whose thorns; asmān—us; pālayataḥ—who was protecting; vīra—O hero; kāmaḥ—desires; te—your; sarve—all; ujjhitāḥ—thrown away.
translation: "Abandoning an unopposed kingdom in the world of men, O valiant one, you neglected all your personal desires while engaged in protecting us.
